TECHNOLOGY.title: AI industry pours millions into politics as lawsuits and feuds ...
TECHNOLOGY.summary: The Artificial Intelligence (AI) industry is increasingly spending major sums in politics as they grapple with growing scrutiny, lawsuits, and policy debates, including a recent wrongful death lawsuit against OpenAI. As part of this, OpenAI and other AI giants are ramping up their lobbying investments and establishing Super Political Action Committees, with Silicon Valley reportedly planning to invest $100m in organizations that will counteract AI regulations. At the same time, there is growing recognition of AI's potential harms, amid lawsuits over AI's impacts on mental health and youth employment.

TECHNOLOGY.title: With just a few messages, biased AI chatbots swayed ...
TECHNOLOGY.summary: A study from the University of Washington found that individuals' political views were likely to lean towards the bias of the AI chatbot they interacted with. Participants who had more knowledge about AI systems were less likely to have their views influenced. The researchers highlight the importance of education about these systems to mitigate potential manipulation.

TECHNOLOGY.title: AI - Forbes
TECHNOLOGY.summary: Spotify has tightened its policies on AI music, spam, impersonation, and fraud, resulting in 75 million "spammy" tracks being removed from its library. Google Photos expands its AI-powered conversational editing feature to all Android devices, allowing users to edit photos via voice or text commands. Tesla's Full-Self Driving Software faced criticism after a test showed the AI system ignoring some street signs and hitting a mannequin child.

AI & EMERGING TECH.title: AI.Gov | President Trump's AI Strategy and Action Plan
AI & EMERGING TECH.summary: The United States, under President Trump, has launched an AI Action Plan aimed at establishing global dominance in artificial intelligence. The plan features three pillars – accelerating innovation, building AI infrastructure, and leading international diplomacy and security. This includes various initiatives and executive orders such as promoting the use of trustworthy AI in the federal government, advancing AI education for American youth, and removing barriers to American leadership in AI.

AI & EMERGING TECH.title: Artificial intelligence - BBC News
AI & EMERGING TECH.summary: The UK government has stated that an AI tool developed by the Cabinet Office helped recover £500m lost to fraud, and Bollywood stars are taking legal action to protect their personality rights due to a surge in deepfake videos. Additionally, Nvidia plans to invest $100bn in AI company OpenAI, Oxford University gave students access to AI platform ChatGPT, and an AI factory is set to handle complex healthcare work.

AI & EMERGING TECH.title: Governor Newsom signs SB 53, advancing California's world ...
AI & EMERGING TECH.summary: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed into law Senate Bill 53, the Transparency in Frontier Artificial Intelligence Act (TFAIA), established to provide online safety by creating boundaries for frontier artificial intelligence (AI) development. The legislation aims to incite public trust while encouraging innovation in AI by installing new requirements for frontier AI developers for transparency, innovation, safety, accountability, and responsiveness. This law indicates California's balance between fostering AI advancement and implementing laws to protect public safety, reconfirming California's position as a leader in the AI industry.

BUSINESS.title: Walmart CEO issues ominous warning to US workers - New York Post
BUSINESS.summary: Walmart CEO Doug McMillon has stated that artificial intelligence (AI) is set to "change literally every job" within the company and may lead to job losses, while also creating new roles. The retailer plans to keep its workforce of 2.1 million workers stable over the next few years, despite automating more roles. Walmart has already started using AI within its supply chain and for gathering product trend data, and the company foresees a ripple effect of AI-related changes across its operations.

BUSINESS.title: AI market bubble concerns grow, plus the government shutdown ...
BUSINESS.summary: Concerns over a potential AI market bubble are increasing, drawing comparisons to the Dot-Com crash. Meanwhile, gold prices continue to rise, surpassing $3,800 per ounce for the first time. Epistrophy Capital Research's Cory Johnson and senior markets reporter Ines Ferré provide analysis on the trends.

POLITICS.title: Trump's team keeps posting AI portraits of him
POLITICS.summary: Donald Trump and his administration are regularly posting artificially generated (AI) images of him on social media, crafting a heroic, yet fictional image of the ex-president. The AI photos are receiving substantial public reaction, feeding into the trend of AI-filtered self-representation in the digital age. Despite criticism and the potential undermining of presidential decorum, Trump's use of AI imagery is strategic, capitalising on the attention it garners.

POLITICS.title: White House officially makes AI a key piece of its ...
POLITICS.summary: The Trump administration is prioritizing artificial intelligence (AI) in its government efficiency agenda for fiscal year 2027 to streamline operations. U.S. Forest Service’s modernization plans have delayed due to staffing losses. Furthermore, the Federal Bureau of Prisons abruptly ended its union contract with the American Federation of Government Employees, impacting the rights of over 30,000 correctional officers, while the IRS is making significant headway on IT modernization despite not decommissioning any legacy systems yet.
